intro: Hibiscus greenwayi, commonly known as the Greenway's hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. The plant features palmately lobed leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Hibiscus greenwayi is often found in moist, shaded habitats within its native range. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in botanical gardens and as a horticultural specimen.
